alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Carter; Coal; Johnston; Murray; Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 15 at 7:41PM CDT until May 15 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR JOHNSTON...COAL...EAST CENTRAL CARTER...SOUTHEASTERN PONTOTOC... CENTRAL ATOKA AND SOUTHEASTERN MURRAY COUNTIES... At 741 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles south of Wardville to 3 miles west of Lehigh to 3 miles south of Connerville to 4 miles north of Mannsville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Sulphur, Atoka, Tishomingo, Coalgate, Dickson, Mannsville, Ravia, Stonewall, Wapanucka, Stringtown, Lehigh, Tupelo, Mill Creek, Milburn, Bromide, Centrahoma, Hickory, Clarita, Olney and Fillmore. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Atoka; Carter; Coal; Johnston; Murray; Pontotoc
